questions.text: What is the SI unit for electric current?
questions.solution: The ampere (A) is the base unit of electric current in the International System of Units (SI).

questions.text: The dimensional formula [ML²T⁻²] represents which physical quantity?
questions.solution: Energy has dimensions [ML²T⁻²]. This can be derived from kinetic energy: KE = ½mv², where [M][LT⁻¹]² = [ML²T⁻²].

questions.text: Is the statement 'Planck's constant has dimensions [ML²T⁻¹]' correct?
questions.solution: Yes, Planck's constant h has dimensions [ML²T⁻¹], which represents energy × time.

questions.text: Which of the following has the same dimensions as pressure?
questions.solution: Pressure has dimensions [ML⁻¹T⁻²]. Energy density (energy/volume), force per unit area, and stress all have the same dimensional formula.
Newton (N) = kg⋅m⋅s⁻², derived from F = ma where force equals mass times acceleration.
